body:
All examples should be tested to be 100% functional before we tag for 1.1.0.

- [x] [Chatterbox](https://github.com/andrewrk/mineflayer/blob/master/examples/chatterbox.js)
- [x] [Chest](https://github.com/andrewrk/mineflayer/blob/master/examples/chest.js)
- [x] [Digger](https://github.com/andrewrk/mineflayer/blob/master/examples/digger.js)
- [x] [Echo](https://github.com/andrewrk/mineflayer/blob/master/examples/echo.js)
- [x] [Graffiti](https://github.com/andrewrk/mineflayer/blob/master/examples/graffiti.js)
- [x] [Inventory](https://github.com/andrewrk/mineflayer/blob/master/examples/inventory.js)
- [x] [Jumper](https://github.com/andrewrk/mineflayer/blob/master/examples/jumper.js)
- [x] [Quitter](https://github.com/andrewrk/mineflayer/blob/master/examples/quitter.js)
- [x] [Sleeper](https://github.com/andrewrk/mineflayer/blob/master/examples/sleeper.js)

Also the test by running `npm test`
- [x] [Test](https://github.com/andrewrk/mineflayer/blob/master/test/test.js)

comment_data.body:
So : 
* Echo now works
* Digger, ChatterBox and Jumper are starting to work a bit : 
    * Digger can now dig (but the bot fly through the air)
    * Chatterbox correctly display the name of the connected players
    * Jumper doesn't crash anymore

The rest is still totally untested so probably crashing and broken.

Chatterbox now works !

* Jumper refuse to make the bot move forward
* the bot is flying
* the inventory is broken

Quitter now works, most of jumper.js now works : 
* [x] jump
* [x] forward
* [x] back
* [x] left
* [x] right
* [x] stop
* [x] tp
* [x] spawn
* [x] pos
* [x] yp
* [x] sprint
* [x] attack
* [x] mount
* [x] dismount

Digger : 
* [x] dig
* [x] build
* [x] list
* [x] dirt

ok digger works,
Inventory : 
* [x] list
* [x] look
* [x] toss
* [x] equip
* [x] unequip
* [x] food
* [x] health
* [x] difficulty
* [x] use
* [x] stop
* [x] craft
Sleeper now works.

So, I fixed reading a sign in graffiti.js.
Updating is not implemented (must be done after placing a block).
Paintings are not in the block.json enum, are they blocks ?

I think we need to know what's the purpose of graffiti.js before calling it fixed.
So dismount still doesn't work, not sure how to do it, wiki.vg says nothing about that.

sprint is fixed
only dismount left in jumper.js

Ok last example, chest.js : 
* [x] chest
* [x] furnace
* [x] dispenser
* [x] enchant
Enchant is broken, and I don't really understand the enchant table (I never used it in the game), so I'm going to let that for later.

https://github.com/andrewrk/mineflayer/blob/master/test/test.js is completely broken except for the chat test.

It's needed to adapt the changed packets in there (at least)

test.js : 
* [x] chat
* [x] entity effects 
* [ ] blockAt : skipped : ok
* [x] gravity + land on solid block + jump
* [x] sets players[player].entity to null upon despawn

I don't know how to fix the map chunk format there https://github.com/andrewrk/mineflayer/blob/master/test/test.js#L83

@roblabla maybe you'd know ?
@rom1504 analogous change to https://github.com/andrewrk/mineflayer/commit/dbe6143b0fd10793b0acd29d6e0614be19e5e3b2
I don't understand the chunk format enough to fix this I'm afraid... I bet it doesn't need a lot of changes though, see there https://github.com/andrewrk/mineflayer/blob/master/test/test.js#L73
Should it still be using zlib ?
Nope. compression is now handled on the protocol level
just the offset to fix now https://github.com/andrewrk/mineflayer/blob/master/test/test.js#L84

I'm going to consider test.js (now internalTest.js) working since the remaining test is skipped (https://github.com/andrewrk/mineflayer/blob/master/test/internalTest.js#L72) and is anyway tested better in externalTest.js
dismount done :)
A painting is an entity, see how that applies to graffiti.js
see http://minecraft.gamepedia.com/Data_values/Entity_IDs + https://github.com/andrewrk/mineflayer/issues/207
e15388bca80ae3387c48188d7b8bebff8961218a fix paintings.
Updating a sign is not implemented but graffiti.js is not trying to do it (https://github.com/andrewrk/mineflayer/issues/180#issuecomment-84521477) so let's consider graffiti.js working.

7304a6cce022fb9f9d27d0b5b22069132ceb389b starts working on fixing enchant, but it still doesn't quite work. What's broken : 
* it seems the slots positions aren't quite correct : put doesn't work every time
* enchant 0 doesn't work

If it worked it would be : 
* enchant -> display what's in the enchantment table
* put swordDiamond -> put a diamond sword in the enchantment table and tell use what our enchantment choices are
* enchant 0 -> do the enchantment and tell use what happens
might be related with the facts that QUICK_BAR_START (https://github.com/andrewrk/mineflayer/blob/master/lib/plugins/inventory.js#L240) and INVENTORY_SLOT_COUNT aren't actually constants.
Since 1.8 enchanting need to put lapis on the enchantment table (http://minecraft.gamepedia.com/Enchanting). This is currently not handled at all by mineflayer and is probably (part) of the problem.
INVENTORY_SLOT_COUNT is actually a constant.
bot.inventory should probably be a function or something, and use the inventorySlotStart of each window (related to https://github.com/andrewrk/mineflayer/issues/118)
The idea is : only one window can ever be open at the same time, so instead of bot.inventory, maybe a bot.currentWindow would make more sense (or for bot.inventory to be bot.currentWindow)
Enchant is fixed. Issue solved :)

rename.from: Ensure all examples work before 1.7 WIP is pulled
rename.to: Ensure all examples work before 2.0.0 is released

rename.from: Ensure all examples work before 2.0.0 is released
rename.to: Ensure all examples work before 1.1.0 is released

milestone.description:
Minecraft 1.8.x compliant bot
All examples should work and code thoroughly checked

title: Ensure all examples work before 1.1.0 is released
